title: Brooklyn Whiskey & Spirits Fest
description: A festival featuring whiskey and spirits tastings, live entertainment, and food vendors.
address: Industry City – Building 5, 33 35th Street, Suite 52A, Brooklyn, NY 11232

title: Amity Gaige: Heartwood with Jennifer Egan
description: A book presentation and conversation with novelist Amity Gaige and Pulitzer Prize-winning author Jennifer Egan.
cost: $5 admission includes a voucher, $28.99 ticket option includes a copy of the book.

title: SciCafe: Sinking Cities
description: An evening conversation series exploring land subsidence and rising sea levels.
address: Cullman Hall of the Universe, American Museum of Natural History, UWS

title: Next Slide Please: A PowerPoint Comedy Show
description: A comedy show featuring comedians delivering humorous PowerPoint presentations.

title: Psycho Therapy with Steve Buscemi, John Magaro, Britt Lower
description: Screenings of the film Psycho Therapy with a Q&A session with the cast and filmmaker.

title: Friends with Caveats
description: A weekly comedy show featuring various performances.

title: Nitehawk Shorts Fest 2025
description: A film festival showcasing short films at Nitehawk Cinema in Williamsburg and Prospect Park.
address: Nitehawk Cinema, Williamsburg and Prospect Park

title: 12th Annual Philip K. Dick Science Fiction Film Festival
description: A film festival featuring science fiction films at various venues including The Producer’s Club and Village East by Angelika.
address: The Producer’s Club, Midtown West; Village East by Angelika, East Village; Stuart Cinema + Cafe, Greenpoint; and online

title: 54th New Directors/New Films Festival
description: A film festival at the Museum of Modern Art and Walter Reade Theater featuring new films.
address: Museum of Modern Art, Midtown; Walter Reade Theater, Lincoln Center

title: Fifth Annual Queering the Canon LGBTQ+ Film Festival
description: A film festival at Brooklyn Academy of Music and online, celebrating LGBTQ+ cinema.
address: Brooklyn Academy of Music, Fort Greene; and online

title: ReelAbilities Film Festival: Reframing Disability
description: A film festival focusing on disability awareness at 12 NYC venues and online.

title: Extended Hours on the High Line
description: Enjoy longer hours at the High Line park starting April 1.

title: Fight Night at 59E59 Theaters
description: A gripping play about a failed amateur boxer presented by Fishamble: The New Play Company.

title: Waterworks: The Hidden Water System of New York
description: A conversation with photographer Stanley Greenberg about his book on New York's water system.
address: Center for Brooklyn History, Brooklyn Heights

title: New York City Fringe Festival
description: An open, lottery-based theater festival featuring independent plays and musicals at various venues.
address: Under St. Marks, Wild Project, The Chain Mainstage, Studio, Rat NYC

title: Big Umbrella Festival
description: Lincoln Center’s annual festival for neurodiverse audiences with performances and interactive programming.

title: Murmuration Theatre Company: Second Annual First Flight Showcase of New Works
description: A showcase of new socially conscious, comedic one-act plays.
